title: Li Yuan becomes Emperor Gaozu of Tang, initiating three centuries of Tang dynasty rule over China.
text: Li Yuan becomes Emperor Gaozu of Tang, initiating three centuries of Tang dynasty rule over China.

title: Ali becomes Caliph of the Rashidun Caliphate
text: Ali becomes Caliph of the Rashidun Caliphate

title: Byzantine–Rus' War: A fleet of about 200 Rus' vessels sails into the Bosphorus and starts pillaging the suburbs of the Byzantine capital Constantinople.
text: Byzantine–Rus' War: A fleet of about 200 Rus' vessels sails into the Bosphorus and starts pillaging the suburbs of the Byzantine capital Constantinople.

title: Battle of Civitate: Three thousand horsemen of Norman Count Humphrey rout the troops of Pope Leo IX.
text: Battle of Civitate: Three thousand horsemen of Norman Count Humphrey rout the troops of Pope Leo IX.

title: Five Canterbury monks see what is possibly the Giordano Bruno crater being formed. It is believed that the current oscillations of the Moon's distance from the Earth (on the order of meters) are a result of this collision.
text: Five Canterbury monks see what is possibly the Giordano Bruno crater being formed. It is believed that the current oscillations of the Moon's distance from the Earth (on the order of meters) are a result of this collision.

title: The Parliament of Ireland meets at Castledermot in County Kildare, the first definitively known meeting of this Irish legislature.
text: The Parliament of Ireland meets at Castledermot in County Kildare, the first definitively known meeting of this Irish legislature.

title: French forces under the leadership of Joan of Arc defeat the main English army under Sir John Fastolf at the Battle of Patay. This turns the tide of the Hundred Years' War.
text: French forces under the leadership of Joan of Arc defeat the main English army under Sir John Fastolf at the Battle of Patay. This turns the tide of the Hundred Years' War.

title: Charles I is crowned King of Scots at St Giles' Cathedral, Edinburgh
text: Charles I is crowned King of Scots at St Giles' Cathedral, Edinburgh

title: The charter of the Massachusetts Bay Colony is revoked via a scire facias writ issued by an English court.
text: The charter of the Massachusetts Bay Colony is revoked via a scire facias writ issued by an English court.

title: Battle of Kolín between Prussian forces under Frederick the Great and an Austrian army under the command of Field Marshal Count Leopold Joseph von Daun in the Seven Years' War.
text: Battle of Kolín between Prussian forces under Frederick the Great and an Austrian army under the command of Field Marshal Count Leopold Joseph von Daun in the Seven Years' War.

title: American Revolutionary War: British troops abandon Philadelphia.
text: American Revolutionary War: British troops abandon Philadelphia.

title: Action of 18 June 1799: A frigate squadron under Rear-admiral Perrée is captured by the British fleet under Lord Keith
text: Action of 18 June 1799: A frigate squadron under Rear-admiral Perrée is captured by the British fleet under Lord Keith

title: The United States declaration of war upon the United Kingdom is signed by President James Madison.
text: The United States declaration of war upon the United Kingdom is signed by President James Madison.

title: Napoleonic Wars: The Battle of Waterloo results in the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte by the Duke of Wellington and Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher forcing him to abdicate the throne of France for the second and last time.
text: Napoleonic Wars: The Battle of Waterloo results in the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte by the Duke of Wellington and Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher forcing him to abdicate the throne of France for the second and last time.

title: French invasion of Algeria.
text: French invasion of Algeria.

title: Charles Darwin receives a paper from Alfred Russel Wallace that includes nearly identical conclusions about evolution as Darwin's own, prompting Darwin to publish his theory.
text: Charles Darwin receives a paper from Alfred Russel Wallace that includes nearly identical conclusions about evolution as Darwin's own, prompting Darwin to publish his theory.

title: First ascent of Aletschhorn, second summit of the Bernese Alps.
text: First ascent of Aletschhorn, second summit of the Bernese Alps.

title: Susan B. Anthony is fined $100 for attempting to vote in the 1872 presidential election.
text: Susan B. Anthony is fined $100 for attempting to vote in the 1872 presidential election.

title: The Reinsurance Treaty between Germany and Russia is signed.
text: The Reinsurance Treaty between Germany and Russia is signed.

title: Empress Dowager Cixi of China orders all foreigners killed, including foreign diplomats and their families.
text: Empress Dowager Cixi of China orders all foreigners killed, including foreign diplomats and their families.

title: Japanese immigration to Brazil begins when 781 people arrive in Santos aboard the ship Kasato-Maru.
text: Japanese immigration to Brazil begins when 781 people arrive in Santos aboard the ship Kasato-Maru.

title: The University of the Philippines is established.
text: The University of the Philippines is established.

title: Checker Taxi puts its first taxi on the streets.
text: Checker Taxi puts its first taxi on the streets.

title: Aviator Amelia Earhart becomes the first woman to fly in an aircraft across the Atlantic Ocean (she is a passenger; Wilmer Stultz is the pilot and Lou Gordon the mechanic).
text: Aviator Amelia Earhart becomes the first woman to fly in an aircraft across the Atlantic Ocean (she is a passenger; Wilmer Stultz is the pilot and Lou Gordon the mechanic).

title: Groundbreaking ceremonies for the Franklin Institute are held.
text: Groundbreaking ceremonies for the Franklin Institute are held.

title: Police in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, clash with striking longshoremen, resulting in a total 60 injuries and 24 arrests.
text: Police in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, clash with striking longshoremen, resulting in a total 60 injuries and 24 arrests.

title: Appeal of 18 June by Charles de Gaulle.
text: Appeal of 18 June by Charles de Gaulle.

title: The "Finest Hour" speech is delivered by Winston Churchill.
text: The "Finest Hour" speech is delivered by Winston Churchill.

title: William Joyce ("Lord Haw-Haw") is charged with treason for his pro-German propaganda broadcasting during World War II.
text: William Joyce ("Lord Haw-Haw") is charged with treason for his pro-German propaganda broadcasting during World War II.

title: Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia, a Socialist, calls for a Direct Action Day against the Portuguese in Goa.
text: Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia, a Socialist, calls for a Direct Action Day against the Portuguese in Goa.

title: Columbia Records introduces the long-playing record album in a public demonstration at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City.
text: Columbia Records introduces the long-playing record album in a public demonstration at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City.

title: The Egyptian revolution of 1952 ends with the overthrow of the Muhammad Ali dynasty and the declaration of the Republic of Egypt.
text: The Egyptian revolution of 1952 ends with the overthrow of the Muhammad Ali dynasty and the declaration of the Republic of Egypt.

title: A United States Air Force C-124 crashes and burns near Tachikawa, Japan, killing 129.
text: A United States Air Force C-124 crashes and burns near Tachikawa, Japan, killing 129.

title: Carlos Castillo Armas leads an invasion force across the Guatemalan border, setting in motion the 1954 Guatemalan coup d'état
text: Carlos Castillo Armas leads an invasion force across the Guatemalan border, setting in motion the 1954 Guatemalan coup d'état

title: Vietnam War: The United States uses B-52 bombers to attack National Liberation Front guerrilla fighters in South Vietnam.
text: Vietnam War: The United States uses B-52 bombers to attack National Liberation Front guerrilla fighters in South Vietnam.

title: Staines air disaster: One hundred eighteen are killed when a BEA H.S. Trident crashes two minutes after take off from London's Heathrow Airport.
text: Staines air disaster: One hundred eighteen are killed when a BEA H.S. Trident crashes two minutes after take off from London's Heathrow Airport.

title: SALT II is signed by the United States and the Soviet Union.
text: SALT II is signed by the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: The Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk, the first operational aircraft initially designed around stealth technology, makes its first flight.
text: The Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk, the first operational aircraft initially designed around stealth technology, makes its first flight.

title: Italian banker Roberto Calvi's body is discovered hanging beneath Blackfriars Bridge in London, England.
text: Italian banker Roberto Calvi's body is discovered hanging beneath Blackfriars Bridge in London, England.

title: Space Shuttle program: STS-7, Astronaut Sally Ride becomes the first American woman in space.
text: Space Shuttle program: STS-7, Astronaut Sally Ride becomes the first American woman in space.

title: Mona Mahmudnizhad together with nine other Bahá'í women, is sentenced to death and hanged in Shiraz, Iran over her religious beliefs.
text: Mona Mahmudnizhad together with nine other Bahá'í women, is sentenced to death and hanged in Shiraz, Iran over her religious beliefs.

title: A major clash between about 5,000 police and a similar number of miners takes place at Orgreave, South Yorkshire, during the 1984–85 UK miners' strike.
text: A major clash between about 5,000 police and a similar number of miners takes place at Orgreave, South Yorkshire, during the 1984–85 UK miners' strike.

title: The Troubles: Members of the Ulster Volunteer Force (UVF) attack a crowded pub with assault rifles in Loughinisland, Northern Ireland. Six Catholic civilians are killed and five wounded. It was crowded with people watching the 1994 FIFA World Cup.
